revised_title: Investigating Dichromic Vision and its Implications on Color Perception
tldr: The author, William Pole, presents a detailed analysis of his own case of color blindness, specifically dichromic vision, and explores the implications of this condition on color perception. He discusses the inability to distinguish certain colors, such as red and green, and the uniformity of the phenomena associated with this defect of vision. The study also offers insights into the primary colors and the potential use of dichromic vision as a tool for analyzing colors in the normal system.
